Cost Model¶

CostModel Component¶

The Cost Model developed as an OpenMDAO component, which defines inputs, outputs, and calls calculation functions.

CostModel Class Input Attributes¶

    hydraulicCapitalCost = Float(100000.0, iotype='in', desc='cost of making change to hydraulics')
    windCapitalCost = Float(100000.0, iotype='in', desc='cost of implementing wind energy')
    solarCapitalCost = Float(100000.0, iotype='in', desc='cost of implementing solar energy')
    triboCapitalCost = Float(100000.0, iotype='in', desc='cost of implementing tribo energy')
    elecUtilityRate = Float(0.1, iotype='in', desc='cost of electricity')
    baselineTotalPowerUse = Float(27765028.90, iotype='in', desc='total GA power use')
    #baselineOceanVoyPowerUse = Float(19948604.08, iotype='in', desc='total ocean voyager power use (protein+sand)')
    baselineOceanVoyPowerUse = Float(16522761.0, iotype='in', desc='total ocean voyager power use (protein+sand)')
    hydraulicPowerUse = Float(19648604.08, iotype='in', desc='total ocean voyager power use')
    yearlyPowerProducedSolar = Float(100.0, iotype='in', desc='solar power produced for given investment')
    yearlyPowerProducedWind = Float(100.0, iotype='in', desc='wind power produced for given investment')
    yearlyPowerProducedTribo = Float(100.0, iotype='in', desc='tribo power produced for given investment')

CostModel Class Output Attributes¶

    totalPowerProduced = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='yearly power output for GA')
    totalPowerConsumed = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='yearly power output for GA')
    totalInitialInvestment = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='investment cost')
    totalEnergyCost = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='what is paid for energy to a utility company')
    totalEnergySaved = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='how much energy we saved with modifications, excluding produced')
    originalEnergyCost = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='what we would have paid for energy to a utility company')
    breakEvenYear = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='year at which we break even for investment')
    year1Roi = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='how much we make for the investment in year 1')
    year5Roi = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='how much we make for the investment in year 5')
    year10Roi = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='how much we make for the investment in year 10')
    year20Roi = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='how much we make for the investment in year 20')
    year30Roi = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='how much we make for the investment in year 30')
    totalUtility = Float(1.0, iotype='out', desc='overall, how good is the solution?')

CostModel Class Constants¶

    expectedReturn = 0.1 # S&P 500 average return
    investmentYears = 10 # Number of years to wait before comparing which decision to make

CostModel Class Definition¶

class Cost.Cost.CostModel[source]¶

Bases: openmdao.main.component.Component

The CostModel exists as an integrating component between the various possible improvements and the aquarium and exhibits. This architecture allows for each improvement and exhibit to implement a very straightforward interface of producing power measures and capital investment costs for the given design configuration. The CostModel aggregates all of these values up and provides the overall comparison metrics of the entire design.

execute()[source]¶

Implements the behavior portion of the OpenMDAO component. Each time all of the models are executed with this method, all of the energy consumed, produced, and the capital invested is used to compare against the current operations of the Georgia Aquarium. With these values, the cost model provides how much was saved, the break even year, the return on investment over many years, and the total utility of the design.

Returns:None

CostModel Calculations¶

Cost.calc_cost.total_energy_produced(yearlyPowerProducedSolar, yearlyPowerProducedTribo, yearlyPowerProducedWind)[source]¶

Sums up the energy produced from all components with this design configuration.

Parameters:
  • yearlyPowerProducedSolar – Solar power production in kWh
  • yearlyPowerProducedTribo – Tribo power production in kWh
  • yearlyPowerProducedWind – Wind power production in kWh
Returns:

Total power production in kWh
Cost.calc_cost.total_energy_consumed(baselineTotalPowerUse, totalEnergySaved, totalPowerProduced)[source]¶

Total energy consumed by all of the power consuming components for this design configuration.

Parameters:
  • baselineTotalPowerUse – Power use of aquarium in the nominal configuration, no changes
  • totalEnergySaved – Total energy that was saved, when compared to nominal case
  • totalPowerProduced – Total energy consumed in kWh for one year with this design configuration
Returns:
Cost.calc_cost.total_energy_cost(elecUtilityRate, totalPowerConsumed)[source]¶

Calculates the energy cost for this design configuration considering the power usage and savings.

Parameters:
  • elecUtilityRate – Cost per kWh in dollars
  • totalPowerConsumed – Total power consumed over the entire year for this design configuration
Returns:

Total cost in dollars for energy for the entire year
Cost.calc_cost.original_energy_cost(elecUtilityRate, baselineTotalPowerUse)[source]¶

Calculates the energy cost for the nominal cost without modifications to anything, for comparison to the current design.

Parameters:
  • elecUtilityRate – Cost per kWh in dollars
  • baselineTotalPowerUse – The total power use for one year in the nominal configuration
Returns:

The total power cost for in one year for the nominal configuration
Cost.calc_cost.total_energy_saved(hydraulicPowerUse, baselineOceanVoyPowerUse)[source]¶

Total energy saved in comparison between the baseline case and the current configuration of the design.

Parameters:
  • hydraulicPowerUse – The power use in kWh for this design for an entire year
  • baselineOceanVoyPowerUse – The power use in kWh for an entire year for the nominal configuration
Returns:

Total energy saved for this configuration over the nominal case in one year in kWh
Cost.calc_cost.calc_roi(totalInitialInvestment, totalEnergyCost, originalEnergyCost)[source]¶

Calculates the return on investment for each year, for 100 years. This can be used to sample the return on investment at any desired year.

Parameters:
  • totalInitialInvestment – Total cost of the changes that have been made for the initial year in dollars
  • totalEnergyCost – Total cost of the energy for this configuration for one year in dollars
  • originalEnergyCost – The energy cost for one year in dollars for the nominal case
Returns:

A numpy.ndarray of 100 return on investment values in dollars, associated with each year
Cost.calc_cost.get_break_even(totalInitialInvestment, totalEnergyCost, originalEnergyCost)[source]¶

Calculates the point at which we break even for the initial investment.

Parameters:
  • totalInitialInvestment – Total cost in dollars for this design configuration.
  • totalEnergyCost – Total energy cost in dollars for the year in dollars
  • originalEnergyCost – Cost of energy for one year in dollars for the nominal configuration
Returns:

The year where we break even for the investment based on the savings
Cost.calc_cost.total_capital_cost(solarCapitalCost, triboCapitalCost, windCapitalCost, hydraulicCapitalCost)[source]¶

Calculates the total cost of this design configuration investment based on all changes that were made.

Parameters:
  • solarCapitalCost – Total investment cost for solar in dollars
  • triboCapitalCost – Total investment cost for tribo in dollars
  • windCapitalCost – Total investment cost for wind in dollars
  • hydraulicCapitalCost – Total investment cost for hydraulics in dollars
Returns:

The total investment cost for this design configuration in dollars
Cost.calc_cost.total_utility(futureRoi, expectedReturn, investmentYears, totalInitialInvestment)[source]¶

Calculates the total utility of this configuration based on current and future returns. This should provide a way to compare solutions together that might provide very little initial turns, but really good future returns, and vice-versa.

Parameters:
  • futureRoi – The return on investment for the year that we are interested in
  • expectedReturn – The return percentage if we were to just invest the money instead
  • investmentYears – The number of years to look into the future for the investment returns
  • totalInitialInvestment – The total investment required for this current design configuration
Returns:

The total utility of this design (no units)
